column1: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic algorithm
column2: Using broken or weak cryptographic algorithms can compromise security.
column4:
The block mode ECB is broken or weak, and should not be used.
The cryptographic algorithm DES is broken or weak, and should not be used.

column2: Using an insecure SSL/TLS version may leave the connection vulnerable to attacks.
column4:
Insecure SSL/TLS protocol version TLSv1 allowed by [["call to ssl.create_default_context"|"relative:///CWE-327/codeql_2.py:15:15:15:42"]].
Insecure SSL/TLS protocol version TLSv1_1 allowed by [["call to ssl.create_default_context"|"relative:///CWE-327/codeql_2.py:15:15:15:42"]].

column1: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithm on sensitive data
column2: Using broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithms can compromise security.
column4: [["Sensitive data (password)"|"relative:///CWE-321/author_1.py:3:19:3:26"]] is used in a hashing algorithm (SHA256) that is insecure for password hashing, since it is not a computationally expensive hash function.

column1: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithm on sensitive data
column2: Using broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithms can compromise security.
column4: [["Sensitive data (password)"|"relative:///CWE-759/mitre_1.py:3:29:3:36"]] is used in a hashing algorithm (SHA256) that is insecure for password hashing, since it is not a computationally expensive hash function.
